description: Implement a basic 3D data visualization component in the Quest 3 app for real-time sensor data, integrating with the backend API and utilizing Meta's Spatial SDK for UI.

userStories.title: Backend API for Real-time Sensor Data
userStories.description: As a Quest 3 app, I need a backend API to fetch real-time sensor data for visualization.
acceptanceCriteria: Create a new API endpoint POST /data/sensors/realtime that accepts device_id and sensor_type
The API should return a stream of sensor data points (e.g., JSON objects) over WebSocket or SSE.
Implement data simulation for testing purposes if real hardware is not connected.
Ensure the API is secured with JWT authentication.
Document the API endpoint, request/response format, and security considerations.

userStories.title: Quest 3 Client Data Fetching
userStories.description: As a Quest 3 app, I need to connect to the backend API to retrieve real-time sensor data.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement a Unity C# script (e.g., `SensorDataManager.cs`) to connect to the backend's real-time sensor data endpoint.
Handle WebSocket/SSE connection lifecycle (connect, disconnect, reconnect).
Parse incoming sensor data streams and store them in an accessible data structure.
Implement error handling for network issues and API failures.
Ensure proper authentication is used when connecting to the backend.

userStories.title: Basic 3D Data Visualization
userStories.description: As a Quest 3 app, I need to display real-time sensor data visually in a 3D environment.
acceptanceCriteria: Create a new Unity scene (e.g., `DataVisualization.unity`) for displaying the 3D visualization.
Develop a Unity C# script (e.g., `DataVizController.cs`) to create and update 3D representations of sensor data.
Visualize at least one type of sensor data (e.g., temperature as a changing color on a 3D model, or pressure as a height map).
Utilize Meta's Spatial SDK for rendering the UI elements related to the visualization (e.g., labels, scales).
Ensure the visualization updates smoothly with incoming real-time data.

userStories.title: Spatial UI for Data Visualization Controls
userStories.description: As a user, I need interactive UI controls within the XR environment to manipulate the 3D data visualization.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement a spatial UI panel (e.g., a hand-attached menu) using Meta's Spatial SDK.
Include controls to switch between different sensor data types (e.g., temperature, humidity, pressure).
Add controls to adjust visualization parameters (e.g., scale, color gradient).
Ensure the UI is intuitive and easily accessible within the VR environment.
Integrate with Quest 3's hand tracking or controller input for interaction with the UI.

userStories.title: Performance Optimization for XR Visualization
userStories.description: As a Quest 3 app, the 3D data visualization needs to run smoothly without performance drops.
acceptanceCriteria: Profile the Unity application to identify performance bottlenecks in the data visualization.
Optimize 3D models and rendering techniques to maintain a target frame rate (e.g., 72fps).
Implement efficient data updating mechanisms to avoid stuttering during real-time data ingestion.
Utilize Unity's Job System or Burst Compiler for computationally intensive tasks if necessary.
Ensure garbage collection is minimized to prevent hitches.

technicalNotes.meta_spatial_sdk: Utilize latest Meta XR SDK for UI and spatial interactions.
technicalNotes.backend_tech: Python Flask for API, WebSockets/SSE for real-time data.
